ngoList.ngoName: Barli Development Institute for Rural Women
ngoList.address: Barli Institute campus,180 Bhamori,new Dewas road (behind Rasoma lab),
ngoList.title: Barli Development Institute for Rural Women
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: - Successfully completed 115 batches - Trained more than 8400 rural and tribal women coming from more than 840 villages - The institute and its heads and staff received numerous awards and achievements including, Global 500 Roll of Honour in 1992 of UNEP, INNOV database of most successful educational programs of UNESCO, Gold Award certification for organisational transparency and program effectiveness by GuideStar India, Order of British Empire OBE, PadmaShri, among others

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Title: Empowering rural and tribal women through training and capacity-building for sustainable community development Purpose: The project proposes to empower socially and economically disadvantaged, marginalized girls and young women from tribal and rural areas from Central India by conducting free residential training program. Their capacity will be built to become agents of change, building up their human capital to become actors in the sustainable development of their communities.

The purpose of the project is to empower young women annually with the skills, knowledge and experience to become health educators among their communities so that when they return to their communities they share their knowledge by using Barli Institutes Health Curriculum - with a special focus on First Aid, HIV/AIDS, Mother and Child-care, Nutrition, Gender equality, and Service to community.

Purpose of the project is to construct additional training facilities like a dormitory and a computer room, and a training hall for enhancing the existing training capacity of the Institute so that more number of tribal girls and young women can be trained each year. The project also enhanced the existing facilities by providing computer systems and related furniture for the women-trainees.

Title: Empowering rural and tribal women through training and capacity-building for sustainable community development Purpose: The project proposes to empower socially and economically disadvantaged, marginalized girls and young women from tribal and rural areas from Central India by conducting free residential training program. Their capacity will be built to become agents of change, building up their human capital to become actors in the sustainable development of their communities.

Purpose: The purpose of the project is to empower young women annually with the skills, knowledge and experience to become health educators among their communities so that when they return to their communities they share their knowledge by using Barli Institutes Health Curriculum - with a special focus on First Aid, HIV/AIDS, Mother and Child-care, Nutrition, Gender equality, and Service to community.

Purpose of the project is to construct additional training facilities like a dormitory and a computer room, and a training hall for enhancing the existing training capacity of the Institute so that more number of tribal girls and young women can be trained each year. The project also enhanced the existing facilities by providing computer systems and related furniture for the women-trainees.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The purpose of the Trust is the promotion of science, cultural, historical research, and education through Gandhian technique of nonviolence. The historical research is the ongoing activity of the trust for identifying and preserving the materials of Mahatma Gandhi and Indias Independence movements The study of Gandhian thought is and will remain important for ages. The purpose of the Trust is the promotion of science, cultural, historical research, and education through Gandhian technique of nonviolence. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The main aim of our All India Level Educational Society is to remove illiteracy from members of the minority and other socially and unprivileged sections of society, as also to equip them with skills to enable these members to lead a life of dignity and self respect. Accordingly the society setup an English Medium school named as Gharibnawaz School of Excellence in Ginnori locality of Bhopal in the year 2003 which is affiliated with MP Board of Secondary Education Bhopal from KG to Class X. The school is imparting quality education to the students at very nominal tuition fee and the results have so far been very encouraging. We have purchased 2.5 acres of land in village Arwaliya which is about 8 kms from Bhopal town where we propose to construct a proper school building with hostel facility as the present building is small is not able to accommodate more students. We have also opened a Vocational Training Centre named as Umang in our school premises which provides training free of cost to women coming from poor families in trades like cutting and tailoring, computer applications and artificial jewellery. So far we have over 1000 poor ladies most of whom have started their own business specially in cutting and tailoring trades enabling them to earn sufficient money to meet their household expenses. We have resolved this charitable work in our institution. In addition our school takes active part extra curricular activities including sports and academics. We are happy to state that our school took part in a state level academic competition called Bal Rung in which the students wrote an excellent article on Goa which has been submitted to Manav Sangralaya, Indira Gandhi Bhawan, Shyamla Hills, Bhopal. In addition our students regularly take part in social and educational activities organised by Urdu Academy Govt of MP Bhopal as for example one held recently on famous poet Iqbal. Our school organises outdoor trip to historical places every year. We also have social gatherings and fates every year in our school. Our students also take part in debates and recently took part in reciting Naths (sufi poetry) organised by the local municipal councellor in which prices were one by them. We plan to open a Play school and Nursery classes in our school premises from next academic year we have also drawn up a calender of events highlighting the extra curricular activities which would be undertaken in the year 2017 - 2018.
